page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Abergele is situated around the river Gele on the coastal plain at the foot of a limestone upland (Pen y Corddyn Mawr) which forms the western slope of the Vale of Clwyd. This was and is a position favoured by travellers, being the easiest route from the industrial populated areas to the east (Deeside, Cheshire, Lancashire etc) to North Wales. The town is one of the oldest settlements in the area. The Town of Abergele itself has a population of approximately 14,000 lying at the foot of a chain of wooded hills approximately .25km from the sea. It has retained its image of a market town with a livestock market on Mondays and Wednesdays. Over the years the area has become more and more popular as a place for elderly people to retire the majority coming from the Manchester area.
